perturbation.original_text: PrimeCall and DeltaThree each agree that for the longest period permitted by law each shall hold in strictest confidence and, without the prior written approval of the other party hereto, not to use for their own benefit or the benefit of any party other than the other party hereto, or disclose to any person, firm or corporation other than such party (other than as required by law) any confidential proprietary information concerning the business and affairs of the other party hereto; provided, however, that the foregoing limitations and restrictions shall not apply to information that (i) is or becomes generally available to the public other than as a result of a disclosure by the directors, officers, shareholders, partners, affiliates, employees, agents or advisors of PrimeCall or DeltaThree, as the case may be, or (ii) is or becomes available to PrimeCall or DeltaThree on a non-confidential basis from a source other than the other party hereto or any of its advisors, agents or affiliates, provided that such source is not known by PrimeCall or DeltaThree, as the case may be, to be bound by a confidentiality agreement with or other obligation of secrecy to the other party hereto.
perturbation.changed_text: PrimeCall and DeltaThree each agree that for the longest period permitted by law each shall hold in strictest confidence and, without the prior written approval of the other party hereto, not to use for their own benefit or the benefit of any party other than the other party hereto, or disclose to any person, firm or corporation other than such party (other than as required by law) any confidential proprietary information or trade secrets concerning the business and affairs of the other party hereto; provided, however, that the foregoing limitations and restrictions shall not apply to information that (i) is or becomes generally available to the public other than as a result of a disclosure by the directors, officers, shareholders, partners, affiliates, employees, agents or advisors of PrimeCall or DeltaThree, as the case may be, or (ii) is or becomes available to PrimeCall or DeltaThree on a non-confidential basis from a source other than the other party hereto or any of its advisors, agents or affiliates, provided that such source is not known by PrimeCall or DeltaThree, as the case may be, to be bound by a confidentiality agreement with or other obligation of secrecy to the other party hereto.
perturbation.explanation: The terms 'confidential proprietary information' and 'trade secrets' are used interchangeably. 'Trade secrets' have a very specific legal definition with requirements for maintaining that status. Using both terms creates ambiguity as to what information is actually protected, potentially weakening the confidentiality provision, because the specific term 'trade secrets' has more legal requirements.

perturbation.original_text: PrimeCall shall negotiate and contract on behalf of DeltaThree to out-source customer service for users of the Calling Card. DeltaThree shall reimburse PrimeCall for all customer service expenses directly related to users of the Calling Card. Notwithstanding the foregoing, the level of customer service shall be subject to the approval of DeltaThree.
perturbation.changed_text: PrimeCall shall negotiate and contract on behalf of DeltaThree to out-source client relations for users of the Calling Card. DeltaThree shall reimburse PrimeCall for all customer service expenses directly related to users of the Calling Card. Notwithstanding the foregoing, the level of customer service shall be subject to the approval of DeltaThree.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'customer service' to 'client relations' introduces ambiguity. While related, these terms can imply different levels of service and relationship management. The text doesn't define if these terms are equivalent, creating confusion as to the exact scope of the outsourced services and reimbursement obligations. The last sentence retains 'customer service' to further compound the confusion.

perturbation.original_text: PrimeCall may assign this Agreement to any affiliate of PrimeCall or in connection with a merger or consolidation of PrimeCall or a sale of all or substantially all of PrimeCall's business. Except as provided in the preceding sentence, this Agreement may not be assigned by PrimeCall without the prior written consent of DeltaThree.
perturbation.changed_text: PrimeCall may transfer this Agreement to any subsidiary of PrimeCall or in connection with a merger or consolidation of PrimeCall or a sale of all or substantially all of PrimeCall's assets. Except as provided in the preceding sentence, this Agreement may not be assigned by PrimeCall without the prior written consent of DeltaThree.
perturbation.explanation: The original text refers to an 'assignment' of the agreement and an 'affiliate' of Primecall. The modified text refers to an 'assignment' of the agreement and a 'subsidiary' of Primecall and a 'transfer' of the agreement and 'assets'. 'Assignment' and 'transfer' can have different legal implications, and the difference between 'affiliate' and 'subsidiary' are also important. Ambiguity is added by stating it may be 'transfered' to a 'subsidiary', yet it can only be 'assigned' with prior written consent, which is only stated in the second sentence. Also, 'assets' implies something very different than 'business'.
